intro: Kibessia verrucosa, commonly known as the roughleaf kibessia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
